snippet: The former prime minister’s sentence, of four hours a week at a home for the elderly, was imposed as an alternative to a year in prison for tax fraud.
abstract: Italian court orders former Prime Min Silvio Berlusconi to spend at least four hours a week, for one year, helping older people in a care home in Lombardy; arrangement is imposed as an alternative to sentence of year in prison he received after 2012 trial for tax fraud.
lead_paragraph: The former prime minister’s sentence, of four hours a week at a home for the elderly, was imposed as an alternative to a year in prison for tax fraud.

headline.main: Milan Court Gives Berlusconi a Year of Community Service
